sentence.Network_en: There was one caveat: he was not to enter into a merger or otherwise weaken the Roche family's control of the firm.

sentence.Network_en: With the caveat that almost every figure in this survey is suspect, it can at least be said that the world travel and tourism industry is huge.

sentence.Network_en: I would offer a caveat for those who want to join me in the dual calling.
sentence.Network_cn: 为防止发生误解，我想对那些想要步我后尘的人提出警告。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, literally let a person beware'

entry.tran: 警告;事先声明;注意事项
entry.def: A  caveat is a warning of a specific limitation of something such as information or an agreement.

example.ex: With the caveat that almost every figure in this survey is suspect, it can at least be said that the world travel and tourism industry is huge...
example.tran: 尽管事先声明此项调查报告中的每个数字都不可靠，但至少可以说，世界旅游观光业的市场庞大。

example.ex: There was one caveat: he was not to enter into a merger or otherwise weaken the Roche family's control of the firm.
example.tran: 有一点需要预先声明：他不得参与合并，或以其他方式削弱罗奇家族对该公司的控制。
